In another match, top seed Milos Raonic defeated Rafael Nadal to set up a semi-final clash with Grigor Dimitrov. British player Aljaz Bedene was also knocked out of the Chennai Open.

The lead singer of U2, who is 50 years old, has undergone treatment at a neurosurgery clinic in Munich. He will recover in his home in Ireland. The band's upcoming tour dates have been postponed, including their appearance at the Glastonbury Festival. More information about the impact on other tour dates will be provided later. U2's manager assures fans that the dates will be rescheduled. Additionally, the band's 360 Degree tour was the most profitable in 2009.

An incident occurred between Abergavenny and Raglan, resulting in two passengers and the pilot being hospitalized. Air accident officials have been notified. The road is closed, with firefighters present. Approximately 120 liters of fuel on board were contained, preventing a larger leak.

Angela Scott will become the new chief executive of the Aberdeen City Council in July. She will replace Valerie Watts, who is leaving for an NHS role. Scott is currently the council's director of corporate governance and is ready to face upcoming financial challenges. Council leader Barney Crockett is pleased with the appointment and believes Scott's financial expertise, drive, and leadership will help deliver on the city's promises. Scott is enthusiastic about working with elected members, colleagues, and partners to prioritize Aberdeen's goals. The salary for the position will be £144,685.

Manchester United full-back Matteo Darmian will be out for several weeks due to a dislocated shoulder sustained in a collision with Wahbi Khazri during their game against Sunderland. With multiple other full-backs already injured, 21-year-old Donald Love, who made his first-team debut, and 19-year-old Cameron Borthwick-Jackson are now the club's only fit options. Manager Louis van Gaal jokingly mentioned the possibility of having to field a 13-year-old player in the position.

Kenneth Harper, convicted of sex crimes and assault last year, had his rape convictions quashed by the Court of Criminal Appeal in Edinburgh. The defence argued that there was no mutual corroboration between the two alleged offenses, which occurred nearly eight years apart and had different circumstances. The Crown claimed similarities, but the court found no compelling evidence to link the two incidents. Harper was still sentenced to three years for the remaining charges.

Veteran actor Jim Broadbent has been cast as Tommy Butler, the investigator of the Great Train Robbery, in the drama series The Great Train Robbery: A Copper's Tale. Broadbent expressed his excitement about the role and mentioned his personal connection to the real-life event. The series is a follow-up to A Robber's Tale, which focuses on the perspective of the robbers. Chris Chibnall, the executive producer and writer, praised Broadbent's casting as being perfect.

A Lithuanian schoolgirl was brutally attacked by a group of 20-25 girls in Central Park, Peterborough. The girl's mother posted a video of the incident on Facebook to help identify the perpetrators. The video has since gone viral with over 680,000 views. The victim explained that the attack was motivated by the group's perception of her as "cheeky" at school. Cambridgeshire Police are currently investigating the incident.

The Maccabees have achieved their first number one album in the UK with Marks To Prove It, narrowly beating Lianne La Havas' Blood. Cilla Black's album, The Very Best of Cilla Black, reached number 14 following her recent death, while One Direction surprised fans with their new single, Drag Me Down. Calvin Harris and Disciples' How Deep Is Your Love climbed to number two, and Little Mix's Black Magic fell to number three. The Maccabees sold just 1,300 more copies than La Havas to secure the top spot.

Zayn Malik has left One Direction to live a normal life. Rumors of the band breaking up spread on social media, but Liam Payne reassured fans. The band continues their tour and will start the European leg soon. Zayn had left due to stress and cheating rumors. He expressed sadness for the fans and stated there was no animosity among the members. Zayn is reportedly working on a solo album with producer Naughty Boy.

Police Scotland is investigating a leak where witnesses' names and details of an alleged gun hit were posted on social media. They are aware of the communication and are conducting inquiries to understand the full circumstances surrounding the incident.

Steven Flynn broke into McDiarmid Park stadium using a crowbar in order to find money to pay off his drug debts. The police responded to an alarm but did not realize there had been a break-in. A cleaner later discovered that cupboards had been rummaged through and alerted the police. Flynn walked around the stadium until the police left, and only then did he steal keys and a charity box. He was sentenced to 16 months in jail.

During a visit to Sleaford, Nigel Farage, supporting UKIP candidate Victoria Ayling, spoke in front of a UKIP poster with a spelling error. The poster read "Hykenham" instead of "Hykeham." Several social media users pointed out the mistake. The BBC contacted UKIP for a response but has not received one yet. The by-election for the vacant seat in the constituency is scheduled for Thursday.

In a quick start, the hosts took the lead within seconds with Blair Henderson's goal. Despite Stirling's efforts, their attempt was blocked by Johnny Fairbairn. Stirling's chances were further diminished when Brian Martin was red-carded for a handball in the area. However, Stirling failed to equalize as Sean Dickson missed a penalty shot.

Fiona Barnes, who previously faked terminal cancer, was sentenced to 15 months in jail for stealing £24,713 from Preston's Space Centre and perverting the course of justice. Despite being ordered to pay back money, she was found to have no assets. The ruling was criticized as outrageous and insulting by the Space Centre. The charity Creative Support has since acquired the centre, securing its future. The Space Centre provides support to children with disabilities.

Experienced 31-year-old defender Adam El-Abd has joined Shropshire-based football club, Shrewsbury Town, after being released by Bristol City. El-Abd, who started his career at Brighton, had over 300 appearances for the Seagulls before moving to Ashton Gate in 2014. He joins former Bury full-back Joe Riley in Shropshire as manager Micky Mellon continues to strengthen the squad for the upcoming League One campaign.

England rugby coach Eddie Jones acknowledges the need for more consistent leaders within his squad if they are to win the 2019 World Cup. Jones highlights that society's changing dynamics, where players no longer have the same opportunities for personal and professional development, contribute to this shortage of leaders. England's coaching staff is actively working on individual leadership plans to address this issue. Jones also identifies Owen Farrell as a potential captain if Dylan Hartley is unavailable.

Somerset County Cricket Club has signed Chris Rogers, who will bat at number three in the upcoming County Championship season. Somerset's director of cricket, Matt Maynard, is pleased with the acquisition, describing Rogers as a marquee player and a great asset to the team. Maynard hopes Rogers' experience will benefit the younger players in the squad, while also providing stability in the batting order.

A Range Rover crashed into a property on Hearthcote Road in Swadlincote, Derbyshire. Luckily, no one was injured, but two residents had to leave their home due to concerns about the structural damage. The police have started an investigation and are appealing for witnesses. The front wall of the property was completely destroyed, and part of it moved several meters from its original position. The road was temporarily closed, and there were no arrests.

The demolition of a building on Kingsway began in October 2015 but has been delayed due to the discovery of more asbestos than anticipated. The council purchased the site with the goal of transforming Kingsway into a business district. Internal renovations have been finished, and the exterior demolition is now supported by scaffolding. The project is expected to be completed by spring.

Blackburn Rovers manager, Gary Bowyer, has called for the Football League to implement goal-line technology after a contentious decision in their match against Wolverhampton Wanderers. Bowyer stated that the rewards in the league are significant and that introducing technology would improve the game. Kit Symons, manager of Fulham, also expressed support for goal-line technology in the Championship.

Leicester City has signed 19-year-old Bartosz Kapustka for £7.5m on a five-year deal. The midfielder impressed at Euro 2016, playing in four of Poland's five games. Kapustka joined the team in Stockholm ahead of a friendly against Barcelona. He is Claudio Ranieri's fifth signing this summer, following Ron-Robert Zieler, Luis Hernandez, Nampalys Mendy, and Ahmed Musa.

The Burrell Collection in Glasgow will close for redevelopment and reopen in 2020. To mark the closure, the museum is hosting free activities, including live music and guided tours. The building, opened in 1983, requires a new roof and other improvements. Currently, only a fifth of the collection is on display. During the closure, some artworks will be exhibited at Kelvingrove Museum. The first exhibition will showcase works by the Glasgow Boys until July 2022.

The poultry processing company, Moy Park, met with officials from the departments of economy and finance to discuss issues with the Northern Ireland RHI scheme. While Finance Minister Ó Muilleoir expressed concerns about the scheme, the company did not mention any concerns in their statement. Moy Park highlighted their experience with energy use in the poultry industry and advocated responsible heat usage. Proposals for cost control measures were submitted but later withdrawn, with the Finance Minister dismissing them as a temporary solution.
A man's body was found in a field near Belsyde Avenue. Police are investigating to identify the man, and a post-mortem examination will be conducted to determine the cause of his death.
